data.text: @pfanderson @hcldr That's wise for you right now. And look into meds & supplements that might aid you in this. I take Quercetin, Vit D3 & Zinc - part of the Covid-19  protocol. Elderberry is good too. Some long haulers are put on Prednisone, but ElderB & some others are contraindicated in its use.
@ProfessorMac @hcldr I am tested for antibodies every few months.

@pfanderson @hcldr Oh I understand. I'm fighting a systemic autoimmune issue myself perhaps not too different from long haul. Yeah you need to learn issues, activities, and environmental habitats that exacerbate the condition. You might also dev antibody deficiency & should get evaluated.

@ProfessorMac @hcldr That is not at all what I meant. I meant that as a person with long covid, my disabilities prevent from undertaking many activities that were normal for me before, because they trigger symptom exacerbations & relapses for me, the patient. #hcldr
@the_rcooper @pfanderson @ShereeseMayMba @hcldr T3 I am the same. family and repair people are fine...but a large group of friends. Still not there yet. #hcldr
@pfanderson @ShereeseMayMba @hcldr Strangers inside the house does feel like the absolutely-necessary category only, but maybe thatâ€™s the anti-social acclimatization talking! #hcldr
@MakeMyDana @hcldr I've been homebound most of the pandemic, and never formed that habit! Well, anymore than I had it before, I mean. #hcldr
